title: TIRE HAVING DECORATIVE SIDEWALL
abstract: Tires having white sidewalls are very popular in the United States and Canada. Tires having white lettering thereon are also very popular. This invention discloses a process for preparing such tires having decorative appliques thereon. By practicing the process of this invention, tires having better uniformity can be built at lower costs than when standard tire building techniques are utilized. This invention specifically relates to a method of preparing a pneumatic rubber tire having a decorative design on the sidewall thereof which comprises (a) applying the decorative design to the sidewall of an uncured tire and (b) curing the tire; wherein the decorative design is comprised of from about 25 weight percent to about 75 weight percent syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene having a melting point which is within the range of about 100°C to about 160°C and from about 25 weight percent to about 75 weight percent of at least one polydiene rubber which is cocurable with said syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene, at least one pigment or colorant, sulfur, and zinc oxide.

motivations: Existing methods for creating tires with decorative sidewalls, such as white sidewalls or lettering, have limitations in terms of uniformity and cost-effectiveness.
objectives: Develop a process for preparing tires with decorative appliques on the sidewall that improves uniformity and reduces costs compared to standard tire building techniques.
methods: Apply a decorative design to the sidewall of an uncured tire using a specific composition, then cure the tire.
Utilize a composition comprising syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene, polydiene rubber, pigment or colorant, sulfur, and zinc oxide for the decorative design.
results: Produce tires with decorative sidewalls that have better uniformity and are built at lower costs than those made with standard techniques.
llama_json.research_subject: Development of a cost-effective process for creating tires with decorative sidewalls

motivations: White sidewall tires and tires with white lettering are popular but can be costly and lack uniformity with standard tire building techniques.
There is a need for a cost-effective and efficient method to produce tires with decorative designs.
objectives: Develop a process for preparing tires with decorative appliques that improves uniformity and reduces costs.
Create a decorative design on the sidewall of a pneumatic rubber tire using specific materials.
methods: Apply the decorative design to the sidewall of an uncured tire.
Cure the tire with the decorative design.
Use a specific composition of syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene, polydiene rubber, pigment or colorant, sulfur, and zinc oxide for the decorative design.
results: Achieve better uniformity in tire decoration at lower costs.
Produce tires with decorative designs using a specific material composition.
openai_json.research_subject: Process for preparing tires with decorative sidewalls

motivations: White sidewalls and white lettering on tires are highly popular in the United States and Canada, creating demand for improved manufacturing methods.
Current tire building techniques for decorative tires result in higher costs and reduced uniformity.
objectives: Develop a process for preparing pneumatic rubber tires with decorative appliques that achieves better uniformity and lower manufacturing costs than standard techniques.
methods: Apply decorative designs to uncured tire sidewalls using a composition containing syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene, polydiene rubber, pigments, sulfur, and zinc oxide.
Cure the tire after applying the decorative design to permanently bond it to the sidewall.
results: Tires with decorative sidewalls can be manufactured with improved uniformity compared to standard techniques.
Manufacturing costs for decorative tires are reduced through the use of this process.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Manufacturing process for decorative tire sidewalls using syndiotactic polybutadiene compositions
